titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the United States Wheat Associates, Walla Walla Branch Records circa 1959-1980
United States Wheat Associates, Walla Walla Branch Records
titlestmt.author: Henry Adams

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-04-08.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard), 2nd Edition.

did.unittitle: United States Wheat Associates, Walla Walla Branch Records

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: United States Wheat Associates (Walla Walla, Wash.)

did.abstract: United States Wheat Associates was founded in 1980, with a focus on adjusting to a global wheat marketplace and dealing with a growing demand for United States wheat classes. The United States Wheat Associates, Walla Walla Branch Records, which dates from 1959 through the 1980s, consist of minutes, budgets, resolutions, financial records, publications, executive board documents, calendars, newspaper clippings, correspondence, membership records, work plans, reports, pamphlets, abstracts, bonds, marketing materials, and founding documents.

acqinfo.p: Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown.

bioghist.p: United States Wheat Associates was originally the Western Wheat Associates (WWA), an organization founded in April of 1959 to expand international markets for wheat from the Pacific Northwest. In 1980, the WWA merged with the Great Plains Wheat Market Development Association to form the United States Wheat Associates, with a focus on adjusting to the global wheat marketplace and dealing with a growing demand for United States wheat classes. United States Wheat Associates work to help wheat buyers, millers, bakers, wheat food processors, and government officials understand the quality, value, and reliability of all six classes of U.S. wheat.

scopecontent.p: The United States Wheat Associates, Walla Walla Branch Records houses the organizational records of the Walla Walla, Washington Branch of the United States Wheat Associates. This collection, which dates from 1959 through the 1980s, consists of minutes, budgets, resolutions, financial records, publications, executive board documents, calendars, newspaper clippings, correspondence, membership records, work plans, reports, pamphlets, abstracts, bonds, marketing materials, and founding documents. This collection documents the wheat industry in Walla Walla.
